Package lepton.engine.rendering

Class Texture

java.lang.Object
lepton.engine.rendering.Texture
public class Texture extends Object
Store some textures. Stores color, bump, and normal textures.

  • Field Details

    • ALBEDO

      public static int ALBEDO

    • NORMAL

    • METALLIC

      public static int METALLIC

    • ROUGHNESS

      public static int ROUGHNESS

    • AO

      public static int AO

    • NUM_TEXTURES

      public static int NUM_TEXTURES
      If you're gonna change this, you NEEEEEED to change this before loading any type of texture (that includes the loadOBJ methods). If you change this after things are loaded... I'm not sure what will happen to you. Correction: I'm not sure what will happen to you in the afterlife after your JVM kills you. This variable describes the number of texture unit things that this will use. Default is 5: albedo, normal, metallic, roughness, and AO. Change if passing different number of textures to shaders.

    • tex_names

      public static String[] tex_names
      For printing / logging purposes. Also please change this ASAP if you're gonna change this at all, like NUM_TEXTURES (but not quite as important).

    • TB_REQUIRED

      public static boolean[] TB_REQUIRED
      Is Tan/Bitan data required for each corresponding texture? (default 0,1,0,0,0 [Index 1 is for normal maps, that's why we need tan/bitan]). Change if you're redoing PBR or adding other texture types.

    • name

      public String name

  • Constructor Details

    • Texture

      public Texture(Texture in)
      Reconstruct a texture based on another one. Effectively clones a texture object. Useful for cache separation. Shallow clone; buffers will still be linked. Use reset() to fix these link issues when separating a texture from a cache.

    • Texture

      public Texture()

    • Texture

      public Texture(TextureImage img, int b)

  • Method Details

    • addRequiredUniformDefaults

      public static void addRequiredUniformDefaults(HashMap<String,Integer> h)
      Given a hashmap of texture unit bindings, add the appropriate ones for textures. Uses tex_names to decide variable names.

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object

    • get

      public TextureImage get(int id)

    • reset

      public void reset(int id)
      Reset a buffer. Options are COLOR, BUMP, NORMAL. Useful for separating a texture from a cache.

    • create

      public void create(int id, String fname, String ext) throws FileNotFoundException
      Make a texture image from a file
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException

    • bind

      public void bind()

    • loadedBitflag

      public int loadedBitflag()
      Example: if albedo and normal textures are loaded it will return 3 (0b00011). Recommended for use in passing data about what's loaded to shaders. Done by default to uniform int "textureUse" (in GObject highRender_customTransform()).
      Returns:
      an int corresponding to what's loaded.
